legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Quarterly Stocks Survey

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: This survey covers UK businesses. The business is the individual company, partnership or sole proprietorship to which the questionnaire has been sent, unless specified otherwise.
Include all stock owned by your business, whether in the UK or abroad.
Include all stocks either held by you or currently in transit within the UK.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

contents.description: You can select the dates of the period you are reporting for, if the given dates are not appropriate.

products in intermediate stages of completion that do not belong to you
all stock owned by your business, whether in the UK or abroad
duty for dutiable goods held out of bond
the value of any goods let out on hire, only if they were charged to current account when acquired and do not rank as capital items for taxation purposes
VAT
stocks you hold that do not belong to you
duty on stocks held in bond
The information supplied is used to estimate changes in stock levels which are used in the compilation of Gross Domestic Product (this link opens in a new tab), the total UK economic activity.
Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is used to measure the UK's financial health and prosperity over time and in comparison to other countries.
The results are used by the Bank of England and HM Treasury to monitor interest rates, inflation and in formulating financial policies, for example, income, expenditure and taxation for the UK.

answers.label: Value of coal stocks at start of the period
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

answers.label: Value of coal stocks at end of the period
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

definitions.title: What we mean by 'work in progress'

contents.description: This refers to goods and services that have been partially processed, fabricated or assembled by the producer but are not usually sold or turned over to others without further processing.

answers.label: Value of work in progress stocks at start of the period
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

blocks.title: For the start of the period, we calculate your business's total value of stocks to be %(total)s. Is this correct?

calculation.title: Total value of stocks at the start of the period

blocks.title: For the end of the period, we calculate your business's total value of stocks to be %(total)s. Is this correct?

calculation.title: Total value of stocks at the end of the period

question.title: Are the end of period figures you have provided estimated?

title.text: Did any significant changes occur to the total value of stocks for {trad_as}?

description: This information will help us to validate your data and should reduce the need to query any figures with you.

contents.description: This is dependent on your own interpretation in relation to your business’s figures from the previous reporting period and the same reporting period last year.

list: change of business structure, merger or takeover
end of accounting period or financial year
impact of global economic conditions
introduction or removal of new legislation or incentive
normal movement for the time of year
one-off increase in stocks
start or end of long term project

question.title: Which of the following are reasons for changes to your business's total value of stocks?

options.label: Change of business structure, merger or takeover
options.value: Change of business structure, merger or takeover

options.label: End of accounting period or financial year
options.value: End of accounting period or financial year

options.label: Introduction or removal of new legislation or incentive
options.value: Introduction or removal of new legislation or incentive

options.label: Normal movement for the time of year
options.value: Normal movement for the time of year

options.label: Start or end of long term project
options.value: Start or end of long term project

options.label: Other
options.description: For example, end of the EU transition period, leaving the EU or other global economic conditions

question.title: Please provide any further details that will help us understand any unusual fluctuations in your stock
description:
Explain any differences between current opening and closing stock values, and any differences between this quarters opening and the previously returned closing stock value.

If you provide comments, we are less likely to contact you with data queries.

contents.description: You have nearly finished! Make sure you continue to the next page and select “submit answers” at the bottom.
Learn more about how use this data (this link opens in a new tab)

submission.title: Check your answers and submit
submission.warning: You must submit this survey to complete it
submission.guidance: You will have the opportunity to view, save or print a copy of your answers after submitting this survey.
